PERFECT REGARDING THE SALE OF PENICILLIN AND SULPHONA MIDBS IN BAHREIN We find that penicillin is on sale in Ifenaraa without restriction, and is being indiscriminately used by unqualified persons. We regard this as inadvisable and ultimately dangerous to the public health. Penicillin is a drug that should only be used as prescribed by a fully qualified doctor. The danger can well be shown by taking the treatment of gonorrhoea, as an example. If a small dose or penicillin which has been partially inactivated by poor storage is used for the treatment of gonorrhoea, the organism will become resistant to the drug. Another small dose may be given and the organism will become.even more resistant. Eventually this results in a case which cannot be treated at all by penicillin. Moreover, any contacts of such a case will have a penicillin resistant gonorrhoea. The same is true of the sulphonamides (sulpha- thiazole, sulphadiazine, etc)., which are also on open sale in Bahrein. Both in the United States and in Great Britain the sale of these drugs is carefully restricted. We would like you to take this matter up with the Bahrein Government and suggest that they restrict the purchase of these drugs to fully qualified medical practitioners, or better still, that they should only be obtainable through the hospitals. titleInfo.title: 'File 2/24 Sale of penicillin and sulphonamides in Bahrain'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are file notes at the end of the file, on folios 19-22. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 23; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-4; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence from Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO), requesting advice from the Political Agent at Bahrain on the unrestricted sale of penicillin and sulphonamides in Bahrain.The file also contains some communications from the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain; and two copies of a proclamation from the Acting Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, in English and Arabic, regulating the sale of penicillin and sulphonamides in the country.
